intro: Dimacria apiifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are broad and lobed, while its flowers consist of yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk. Dimacria apiifolia is known for its ability to tolerate dry conditions and is often found in disturbed habitats.
